text:
eh, anyone know how to fix this problem, what's wrong with GR,
```julia> create_sysimage([:MLJ, :DataFrames, :Plots], sysimage_path="julia-images/julia-dev.so")
ERROR: LoadError: LoadError: InitError: Evaluation into the closed module `GR` breaks incremental compilation because the side effects will not be permanent. This is likely due to some other module mutating `GR` with `eval` during precompilation - don't do this.```

elements.text: eh, anyone know how to fix this problem, what's wrong with GR,

julia> create_sysimage([:MLJ, :DataFrames, :Plots], sysimage_path="julia-images/julia-dev.so")
ERROR: LoadError: LoadError: InitError: Evaluation into the closed module `GR` breaks incremental compilation because the side effects will not be permanent. This is likely due to some other module mutating `GR` with `eval` during precompilation - don't do this.

text: I got the same thing just by updating my packages

elements.text: I got the same thing just by updating my packages

attachments.title: "LoadError: InitError: Evaluation into the closed module `GR` breaks incremental compilation..."
attachments.text: Thanks, ]build Plots did it! That was an easy fix! And good to know about gr().
